title: Enormous rat (dNetHack)

| An enormous rat:* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). |                   |

An **enormous rat**, r, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears as part of the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch incorporated in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). The enormous rat is a [small](/wiki/Small "Small") [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is slightly larger than other early [rodents](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). Like other [rats](/wiki/Rat "Rat"), Convicts can pacify or tame them by [chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to one.

An enormous rat has a single bite attack.

## Generation

Randomly generated enormous rats are always hostile, and may appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). A giant rat can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into an enormous rat, and an enormous rat can grow up into a [rodent of unusual size](/wiki/Rodent_of_unusual_size_\(dNetHack\) "Rodent of unusual size (dNetHack)").

The enormous rat makes up 96⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Madman quest](/wiki/Madman_quest "Madman quest") as the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster for [Madmen](/wiki/Madmen "Madmen") that are above the locate level of the branch - enormous rats also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for those levels and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated there.

Enormous rats appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the quests of the following roles:

- [Convict quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest")
- [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest")
- [Pirate quest](/wiki/Pirate_quest "Pirate quest")
- [Tourist quest](/index.php?title=Tourist_quest/dNetHack\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Tourist quest/dNetHack (page does not exist)")

## Encyclopedia entry

To set certain popular misconceptions to rest once and for all:  
  
1\) He was not found wandering the sewers of London as a child during  
the winter of 1864, unable to say anything more than "Powerful  
big rats, gentlemen."  
  
2\) He was never exhibited in public houses to the curious; only  
briefly in July, 1865, to selected gentlemen of standing from  
the scientific and literary community.  
  
3\) He did not have a vestigial tail.  
  
4\) He did indeed have what most people would commonly understand  
as "eyes."  
  
5\) He was not actually the pilot of the Zeppelin, although he did  
disappear for good following the explosion.  
  
6\) There is obviously no "underground kingdom beneath London,  
inhabited by huge, intelligent rodents." And even if there were,  
and suggestion of Neil's involvement in the mazy territorial  
negotiations between Londons Above and Below can be considered a  
joke, and in poor taste at that.  
  
7\) He was afraid of neither mirrors nor street conjurers.  
  
8\) There were no tooth marks on the bones.  
\[ The Season of Mists, Neil Gaiman ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Enormous_rat_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit)*

html:
Enormous rat (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
r enormous rat
Difficulty 4
Attacks Bite 1d6 physical
r enormous rat
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Bite 1d6 physical

Base level 3
Base experience 40
Speed 9
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 200
Nutritional value 100
Size small
Resistances none
Resistances conveyed none

An enormous rat:

  • is an animal.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.

An enormous rat, r, is a type of monster that appears as part of the Convict patch incorporated in dNetHack and notdNetHack. The enormous rat is a small carnivorous animal that is slightly larger than other early rodents, and can be seen via infravision. Like other rats, Convicts can pacify or tame them by chatting to one.

An enormous rat has a single bite attack.

Generation

Randomly generated enormous rats are always hostile, and may appear in small groups. A giant rat can grow up into an enormous rat, and an enormous rat can grow up into a rodent of unusual size.

The enormous rat makes up 96⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Madman quest as the first quest monster for Madmen that are above the locate level of the branch - enormous rats also appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for those levels and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated there.

Enormous rats appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the quests of the following roles:

  • Convict quest
  • Healer quest
  • Pirate quest
  • Tourist quest

Encyclopedia entry

To set certain popular misconceptions to rest once and for all:

1) He was not found wandering the sewers of London as a child during
the winter of 1864, unable to say anything more than "Powerful
big rats, gentlemen."

2) He was never exhibited in public houses to the curious; only
briefly in July, 1865, to selected gentlemen of standing from
the scientific and literary community.

3) He did not have a vestigial tail.

4) He did indeed have what most people would commonly understand
as "eyes."

5) He was not actually the pilot of the Zeppelin, although he did
disappear for good following the explosion.

6) There is obviously no "underground kingdom beneath London,
inhabited by huge, intelligent rodents." And even if there were,
and suggestion of Neil's involvement in the mazy territorial
negotiations between Londons Above and Below can be considered a
joke, and in poor taste at that.

7) He was afraid of neither mirrors nor street conjurers.

8) There were no tooth marks on the bones.
[ The Season of Mists, Neil Gaiman ]

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

An '''enormous rat''', {{monsym|enormous rat}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears as part of the [[Convict]] patch incorporated in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. The enormous rat is a [[small]] [[carnivorous]] [[animal]] that is slightly larger than other early [[rodent]]s, and can be seen via [[infravision]]. Like other [[rat]]s, Convicts can pacify or tame them by [[chatting]] to one.

An enormous rat has a single bite attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated enormous rats are always hostile, and may appear in small [[group]]s. A giant rat can [[grow up]] into an enormous rat, and an enormous rat can grow up into a [[Rodent of unusual size (dNetHack)|rodent of unusual size]].

The enormous rat makes up {{frac|96|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Madman quest]] as the first [[quest]] monster for [[Madmen]] that are above the locate level of the branch - enormous rats also appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest [[monster class]] for those levels and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated there.

Enormous rats appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the quests of the following roles:

* [[Convict quest]]
* [[Healer quest]]
* [[Pirate quest]]
* [[Tourist quest/dNetHack|Tourist quest]]

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
	To set certain popular misconceptions to rest once and for all:
	
	1) He was not found wandering the sewers of London as a child during
		the winter of 1864, unable to say anything more than "Powerful 
		big rats, gentlemen."
	
	2) He was never exhibited in public houses to the curious; only 
		briefly in July, 1865, to selected gentlemen of standing from 
		the scientific and literary community.
	
	3) He did not have a vestigial tail.
	
	4) He did indeed have what most people would commonly understand 
		as "eyes."
	
	5) He was not actually the pilot of the Zeppelin, although he did 
		disappear for good following the explosion.

	6) There is obviously no "underground kingdom beneath London, 
		inhabited by huge, intelligent rodents." And even if there were,
		and suggestion of Neil's involvement in the mazy territorial
		negotiations between Londons Above and Below can be considered a
		joke, and in poor taste at that.
	
	7) He was afraid of neither mirrors nor street conjurers.
	
	8) There were no tooth marks on the bones.
		[ The Season of Mists, Neil Gaiman ]
}}
